tips.description: A healthy lawn should receive 1 to 1.5 inches of water per week.
In season, always mow at your lawnmower's highest height. You may have to mow more often, but your grass will thank you!
While it won't directly make your lawn healthier, regular edging will make it look cleaner and fuller.
Regular lawnmower maintenance will help prevent unexpected breakdowns, as well as help your lawn! Make sure the engine is well-oiled, and the blade sharpened or replaced regularly.
